note.body: The mention of `gdk_pixbuf_new_from_xpm_data()` should also be dropped from the [`GdkPixbuf` class description](https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/gdk-pixbuf/-/blob/master/gdk-pixbuf/gdk-pixbuf.c#L55).

This is not *exactly* true; you can still use XPM, but:

- you need to go through the other I/O API, instead of this special snowflake of a loader
- you need to handle any loading error in case the XPM loader isn't available

So I'd use:

```suggestion:-0+0
 * Deprecated: 2.44: Use [ctor@Pixbuf.new_from_stream] with a [class@Gio.MemoryInputStream],
 *   making sure to handle errors in case the XPM format loader is not available
```
Another thing we need to get rid of is `__GTK_DOC_IGNORE__`.
We need to phase `GDK_PIXBUF_DISABLE_DEPRECATED`: it's useless (now that gtk-doc is gone), and it's a terrible approach that has been wholly replaced by the `DEPRECATED_BY` annotations.

target_title: (CVE-2020-29385) endless loop in the write_indexes function in gdk-pixbuf/lzw.c (from melvin@melvinkool.nl)
docs: Fix dead link in CONTRIBUTING
docs: Fix dead link in CONTRIBUTING

note.body: Could it be a typo? glyin => glycin
A better way to do the sandbox disabling would be for the thumbnailer sandboxing code to put an immutable marker a la /.flatpak-info into the sandbox.

Currently, glycin is just blasting to stderr if it's not sandboxed:

```rust
eprintln!("WARNING: Glycin running without sandbox.");
```

We might want to make that a warning as well.

Should be replaced by `g_debug()`:

```suggestion:-0+0
      g_debug ("In thumbnailer, running unsandboxed");
```

Adding a comment so we don't forget when merging.
I've added a quick sketch of that now.
You can make it work for plain files on linux using fileno and readlink on /proc/\$pid/fd/\$fd

push_data.commit_title: Turn sandboxing off in the thumbnailer

note.body: For the thumbnailer, the suggestion would be to replace the gdk-pixbuf thumbnailer with a glycin thumbnailer, which can use the glycin api directly to disable its own sandboxing.

It would be nice if we could avoid making a copy of the file for the non-incremental case.

But there's the obstacle that the gdk-pixbuf module API is in terms of FILE\*, while glycins API expects a GFile.
None of them are, if you consider macOS as platform we care about, unless there's a glycin story for macOS.

> figure out if we want to have some smart build machinery around this, or just rely on distributors to do the right thing

I would outright delete all of the decoders that are obsoleted by glycin. We're responsible for whatever code we don't delete.

More fully fleshed out now.

I've build a libgdk_pixbuf with the only builtin loaders being the glycin ones, and can launch apps, which show their icons like normal.

So, success?

Left to do:

* figure out if we want to have some smart build machinery around this, or just rely on distributors to do the right thing
* support more of glycins memory formats

target_title: Conditional jump or move depends on uninitialised value(s) on diff2_rgb()

note.body: I see this on OpenIndiana with gdk-pixbuf 2.42.12 and libjpeg-turbo 3.0.4 when compiled either 32-bit or 64-bit.
